--- title: sports_generic.objects keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "A module of generic sports objects based on the `Base_Handler` class." description: "A module of generic sports objects based on the `Base_Handler` class." nb_path: "01_sports_generic.objects.ipynb" ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

These classes are meant to serve as base objects that should scale to multiple types of sports and therefore are quite generic. The can be inherited and used to scale out a project as shown in the example documents.

To have a property carry between a DataFrame and an object it must be decorated as a property! Note that all attributes that are assigned to the object also need to be present at the top level of the class outside of __init__ for the get_properties method to work - I think this can be fixed since we actually don't want to return these attributes anyway

{% raw %}

class Team[source]

Team(object_id=None, name=None, division=None, seed=None, players=None) :: Base_Object

Simple class to hold team info

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Let's try making a team

{% raw %} 
from IPython.display import JSON

colts = Team(name='Colts', division='AFC South')
JSON(colts.get_properties())

<IPython.core.display.JSON object>
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class Player[source]

Player(object_id=None, name=None, age=None, position=None, height=None, weight=None, college=None, team_id=None) :: Base_Object

Game class is an object for each tournament slot that is populated as the tournament continues. It also holds functions relavent to a game like updating teams from the results dict and returning a winner based on the predictions from the submission class.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Or try making a player:

{% raw %} 
player = Player(name='Darius Leonard',college='South Carolina State', height=1.88, weight=104)
player

Darius Leonard
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

class Game[source]

Game(object_id=None, t1_id=None, t2_id=None, t1_score=None, t2_score=None, win_id=None, day=None, year=None, location=None, teams=None, players=None) :: Base_Object

Game class is an object for each tournament slot that is populated as the tournament continues. It also holds functions relavent to a game like updating teams from the results dict and returning a winner based on the predictions from the submission class.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

And a game:

{% raw %} 
texans = Team(name='Texans', division='AFC South')

rivalry = Game(t1_id=colts.object_id, t2_id=texans.object_id)
{% endraw %}
